abstract: United Nations Children's Fund issues report that reveals more than million children have been forced to abandon school in northeastern Nigeria and surrounding countries due to violence and attacks against civilians by militant Islamist group Boko Haram.
lead_paragraph: The report said the conflict in the region, where the militant Islamist group Boko Haram has targeted educational institutions, has kept many children out of classes for more than a year.

headline.main: Nigeria: Strife Puts Education at Risk for a Million Children, Unicef Says
headline.print_headline: Africa; Nigeria: Strife Puts Education at Risk For a Million Children, Unicef Says

snippet: The report said the conflict in the region, where the militant Islamist group Boko Haram has targeted educational institutions, has kept many children out of classes for more than a year.
